driver.name: SNMP
driver.description:
The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) is an Internet-standard protocol for monitoring and management of devices on IP networks.
The driver acts as a manager in the network and connects to devices, representing agents, via their IP address. Manager-to-agents requests can be done to data channels, addressed through their full object identifiers (OID).

option.name: IP address
option.description: The IP address of the SNMP agent device.

option.name: Port
option.description:
The address port of the target SNMP agent device.
By convention, SNMP agents use the UDP-Port 161, while sending traps to 162.

option.name: Version
option.description: The version of the used SNMP communication protocol.

option.name: Authentication passphrase/Community
option.description:
The authentication passphrase build credentials together with the security name. For SNMPv1/v2c, The authentication passphrase corresponds to the community word.
By convention, most devices with SNMPv1/v2c have a read-only community "public". For read and write access, the community string has to be set to "private".

option.name: User name
option.description:
The user name of the chosen authentication credentials.

Only used for SNMPv3 connections.

option.name: Security name
option.description:
The security name of the user (typically the user name).

Only used for SNMPv3 connections.

option.name: Privacy passphrase
option.description:
The privacy passphrase authenticates the selected security level.

Only used for SNMPv3 connections.

option.name: Version
option.description:
The version of the used SNMP communication protocol.

Currently, scanning is only available vor SNMPv2c.

option.name: Community
option.description:
For SNMPv1/v2c, The authentication passphrase corresponds to the community word.
By convention, most devices with SNMPv1/v2c have a read-only community "public". For read and write access, the community string has to be set to "private".

option.name: Start of selected IP range
option.description: The start IP of the selected range to scan for SNMP device agents.

option.name: End of selected IP range
option.description: The end IP of the selected range to scan for SNMP device agents.

option.name: Object Identifier (OID)
option.description: The object identifier of the agents data channel.
